name: Release v1.3.6
body:
__New__:

name: Release v1.3.1
body:

- Added more stats, recent games, as well as global stats (if available) for the selected deck.
- Added "Most Played" as a deck sorting option.

__Changes__:
- Greatly improved the deck screenshot dialog.
  - Deck images can now also be copied to the clipboard.

name: Release v1.2.3

name: Release v0.15.4
body:
**Changes:**
- Drastically improved CPU usage. 
- The `max season` filter in stats can now be left empty to include everything up to the present.

- Fixed an issue where HDT would freeze when after long animations in Hearthstone (Brawl, Harrison Jones, ...).

name: Release v0.14.5
body:
**New:**
- Added **C'Thun and Yogg-Saron counters**. By default these should (hopefully) show up when appropriate. You can turn them on/off permanently under `options > overlay > player/opponent`.

**Fixes:**
- **Fixed importing decks from hearthpwn**. Let the netdecking commence!
- Fixed an issue where no C'Thun would be added to the deck list after Doomcaller was played.
- Fixed an issue where the arena reward dialog was missing the WotOG cards and packs.
- Fixed an issue where some card images would have a few pixels of transparency on the right.
- Fixed an issue where importing the opponent deck from games would result in a deck without a class.
- Fixed an issue where the deck picker would switch to "wild" after creating a standard deck.
- Fixed an issue where the last played date on decks would not always update.
- Fixed an issue where importing the player deck from the last game would include the hero and hero power.
- Fixed an issue where the opponent deck recorded on matches could include created cards (new matches only).

**Changes:**
- Moved board attack counters to `options > overlay > player/opponent`.
- Added missing WotOG token images.

**API-_ish_**:
- Most enums in `Hearthstone_Deck_Tracker.Enums` have been removed since they were duplicates of `HearthDb.Enums`. The latter is now used exclusively. This might break plugins again, sorry.

name: Release v0.14.4
body:
**Updated for Hearthstone 5.0.0.12574**
- Fixed deck exporting. Set filter selection might break again once WotOG is actually released. If it does, temporarily turn off `options (advanced) > tracker > exporting > auto clear filters`.
- **Note:** This release does not yet contain features related to new cards and their behavior. Tracking for some new cards might not work correctly.

**New:**
- Added all new **constructed stats** page! Now with lots of charts and filters.
- Added support for standard/wild. Decks are automatically detected as "standard viable".
- The opponent cards now include created cards again. (can be disabled under `options > overlay > opponent`)
- Now tracks legend rank.

**Fixes:**
- Fixed an issue where Thaurissan cost reduction would not stop increasing.
- Fixed an issue where the overlay would sometimes stop updating.
- Fixed an issue where auto deck selection would something change the active version.
- Fixed an issue where trying to edit a match without an opponent hero would crash HDT.
- Fixed an issue where a wrong deck name would sometimes be used in the overlay or when exporting.
- Fixed importing from hearthstoneheroes.

**Changes**
- Updated the way some data is stored. You will get a 'maintenance required' notification when starting HDT, this will merge all relevant data from files in _%AppData%/HearthstoneDeckTracker/Games_ into the respective game stats and delete the unnecessary files. This should only take a few seconds in most cases.

**API:**
- Added `GameEvents.OnAttack`.

**Note:** This release will break a few plugins (at least _Arena Helper_ and _Collection Tracker_).

**Changes:**

- Made a few improvements on the turn timer.

- Fixed an issue where Jaraxxus drawn during mulligan would not be tracked.

- Fixed an issue where importing from hearthstonetopdeck would not work.

name: Release v0.13.16
body:
**Updated for Hearthstone 4.2.0.12051**
- Fixed an issue where exporting to Hearthstone would not work.
- Fixed an issue where changing the region would not be detected.
- Fixed an issue where cards added to the deck would not be tracked correctly (e.g. by Elise or Torch).
- Added Thai language option.
- _There might be a few remaining issues caused by the update. Let me know and I will do my best to fix those asap._

**Fixes**:
- Fixed an issue where cards created by Golden Monkey would not be tracked correctly.
- Fixed an issue where the opponent hand marks could accidentally reveal too much information. 
- Fixed an issue where long card names could get truncated.
- Fixed an issue where it was not possible to set some cards as rewards in the arena reward dialog.
- Fixed an issue where playing a second coin in a match could result in the wrong player being recorded as "first".
- Fixed an issue where discarded cards would not be tracked in no-deck mode.
- Fixed an issue where HDT would crash on machines without a Hearthstone installation.
- Hopefully fixed an issue where HDT would stop working at 12:00am.
- Secrets:
  - Fixed an issue where minions removed from the game (e.g. by Polymorph) could cause secrets to gray out.
  - Fixed an issue where Counterspell would not gray out when playing a secret.
  - Fixed an issue where Spellbender would gray out when the opponent has a full board.
  - Fixed an issue where Duplicate would gray out when the opponent has a full hand.
  - Fixed an issue where Snake Trap would gray out when the opponent has a full board.

**Changes**:
- Updated card images to look much more (that is, _exactly_) like the in-game ones.
- HDT now tries to restore the original match start time after reconnected matches.
- The date format for the last played date display on deck can now be set under `options > tracker > appearance`.
- Exporting decks to Hearthstone in non-latin languages (except Thai for the moment) should now be less likely to select wrong cards.

name: Release v0.13.14
body: - Fixed a possible crash on match start.

name: Release v0.13.13
body:
**Fixes**:
- Fixed an issue where games would not be recorded when re-joining after disconnects.
  - Joining in-progress games (reconnected or spectator) now correctly displays the decks.
- Fixed an issue where the turn timer would sometimes start on the wrong player.
- Fixed an issue where importing constructed decks from the game would not work for brawl decks.
- Fixed an issue where the "classic" set filter in the deck builder would not work.
- Fixed an issue where cards created in the deck were not marked as such.
- Fixed an issue where friendly secrets triggering on the players turn (i.e. Competitive Spirit) would cause Counterspell to grey out.
- Fixed an issue where stats would be displayed for games that were not set to be recorded.
- Fixed an issue where the secrets panel would be visible in menu after restarting the game.
- Fixed several mid-game crashes.

**Changes**:
- Options menu: many less frequently needed options are now hidden under "Advanced options" by default.

**API**:
- Fixed an issue where `OnTurnStart` would trigger twice on the first turn.
- Fixed an issue where calling `ScreenCapture.CaptureHearthstone` would result in a deadlock.

name: Release v0.13.12
body:
**New:**
- Added a search feature to the options menu.
- Added an option to disable card limits when building a constructed deck.

**New:**

If you for need ConsolePrinting enabled for some reason, you can set `LogConfigConsolePrinting` in the `config.xml`.

**API:**
- Due to the LogReader changes, `API.LogEvents.OnLogLine` no longer exists but is now split into `API.LogEvents.OnPowerLogLine`, `API.LogEvents.OnBobLogLine`, etc. If you need other log types I suggest manually creating a new `LogReader.LogReader` instance.

name: Release v0.10.2

name: Release v0.9.7

body:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7737910/6098187/702afce6-afd7-11e4-9ab7-0dc7363e930f.png)

name: Release v0.8.0
body:
## **New:**
- **Now supporting NetDeck:** ![64_netdeck](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7737910/5987364/a80ea346-a925-11e4-83dd-f7c672f524ad.png)

  - Exporting decks to Hearthstone will now display missing cards afterwards (this currently has issues if cards have the blue "new" text at the bottom)

  - 1) Saving a edited deck will give you the option to save your deck with a new version number. (current, minor increment, major increment, as well as "save as new")

name: Release v0.6.3
body:

name: Release v0.4.3
body:

name: Release v0.4.2
body:
**Auto Updater!**

**Changes / Fixes:**
- Added an option to enable "full text search" when creating decks (options > general > other). This takes into account the name, text, rarity (english only) and race/type (english only).
- Switching decks during a game no longer causes actions to be recorded multiple times.
- Turn numbers in game details should now be correct with minor exceptions to mulligan-draws.
- Doubleclicking tables in stats no longer causes crashes.

- The list of games is not scollable via mousewheel
- Fixed setting tags via more... > tags.

name: Release v0.4.1
body: - Should fix crashes on startup some were experiencing with release v0.4.0.

name: Release v0.4.0
body:
**New Feature: Stats Tracking**
- Stats for each deck can now be tracked!
  - Result of games (win/loss),  opponents, game mode and more
- Win/loss rate vs each class.
- Details for each game (cards drawn, played, etc.).
- Select which game modes to track (Options > Other).  
- Import your opponent's (partial) deck from a tracked game as a new deck.
- More to come!

**Changes / Fixes:**  
- Update checks now occur on every start of Hearthstone.
- Update checks can be disabled completely.
- Tray icon now visibile by default, with (simple) context menu.
- Cards returned from play no longer count as "obtained" if that option is enabled.
- Closing the Tracker with windows minimized will no longer cause them to disappear on next start.
- "Import from file" will no longer crash the Tracker under certain circumstances.
- Setting tags in "New Deck" will no longer cause the selected tags in "My Decks" to change.
- If "hide overlay in menu" is selected, the decks will now stay visible until _actually_ back in menu (after the defeat/victory screen was left).
- Possibly fixed an issue where the execution path would be wrong, causing the tracker to crash.
- Fixed, when exporting decks to Hearthstone (french): Lightning bolt, Silence.
- Overlay no longer pops up at start if Hearthstone is not running.
- Removed "game logging" with the addition of stats tracking.

**Known issues / workarounds:**
- Switching decks during a game causes actions to be recorded multiple times.
- If stats tracking does not work properly, restart Heartstone and the Tracker once.
- Overwriting a deck using a new deck with the same name keeps the old stats.
- Turn number seems to not get recorded correctly sometimes.
- Doubleclicking in the Stats > Overview or the "Result"-row in Stats > Games causes the Tracker to crash.

name: Release v0.3.21
body:
Quick fix for some issues caused by the last update. (See notes below for new features if you didn't download v0.3.20)
- Fixed cards getting removed from deck even though the option was not enabled (main reason for this update).
- Fixed cards gettings removed from deck that were not supposed to (with option enabled).
- Fixed cards from e.g. tracking being treated as "obtained" and removed when played if the option was enabled.
- Fixed deck count when "include obtained" is enabled
- Fixed deck not updating properly when turning "remove when count is 0" on/off
- Added missing cards to additional overlay tooltips (bane of doom, power of the horde)

_known issues:_  
- _cards returned from the battlefield (cancelled battlecry, sap, shadowstep, brew, etc) are counted as "obtained" if that option is enabled_
- _Closing the tracker while it's minimized causes it to not appear when started the next time (also if done before the update). Same goes for the "additional windows".  
  Workarounds for now:  
  a) don't close it while it's minimized :),  
  b) if you did, **alt-tab to the tracker and press Win-(Right Arrow) if you're on Win7/8, or Alt+Space+X for vista** until you see it._

### **If you can't see the tracker after starting, read above**

Sorry for the inconvenience, that'll be fixed with the next update.

name: Release v0.3.20
body:
**Clicking secrets and hiding friendslist are now disabled by default** The method used to detect mouse clicks for those features can cause freezing issues. They can be re-enable in Options > General > Overlay.

**Features:**
- Added additional tooltips in the overlay for Ysera, ETC, Gelbin Mekkatorque and Animal Companion, which display the drawable cards / summonable minions. (Can be disabled in Options > General > Overlay)
- If the last game was played in "No Deck"-mode, the drawn cards can now be imported as a new deck (New Deck > Import > From last game). Mainly meant for arena.
- Option to include "obtained cards" in the playercards (coin, from thoughtsteal, etc) - the feature above ignores these. (_known issue: enabling this currently throws off the deck-count_)
- Using "Remove cards if count is 0" and "Highlight cards in hand" now only removes a card if it's no longer in hand.
- When trying to save a new deck with an existing name (e.g. "Arena"), an option to overwrite the deck is presented.

**Fixes/Changes:**
- Performance improvements
- Fixed an issue where secrets were only clickable if overlay tooltips were enabled.
- Removed message balloon when minimizing to tray.
- Fixed timer window size not being saved proplerly.
- Fixed saving window positions with multiple screens.
- Hearthstones Log now gets cleared after every game. (Can be disabled in the config file if needed)

If there's no major bugs in this release the update spam should decrease after this :).

name: Release v0.2.12
body:
+**Semi-automatic deck detection**: You still have to create decks in the tracker. But it will now do two things: 
    1) If you are starting a game with a different class than the deck you have selected is, it will select the last deck you used with the class you are playing. 
    2) If you are starting a game with the same class as the deck you have selected, it will check if the cards you draw actually match your deck. If any draw doesn't, it will either automatically select the correct deck if there is only one that matches the draws or present you with a list possbile matches.

+**Enemy draw chances**:  In addition to your draw chances, chances for drawing and _having_ cards can now displayed for the enemy as well! You can read more about this in the (new) help tab.

+**Deck notes**: You can now set notes for each deck (matchups, mulligan notes, whatever you like). These can be viewed and edited in the "My Decks" section by clicking on the "Notes" button.

+**Turn timer**: The tracker now comes with a turntimer, both in the overlay and in a window! Thanks a lot to @WodeCraft for this. There maybe some issues with it not being 100% in sync with the actual turn time. You can customize the position, etc. in the options.

+Additional windows can now be set to only be topmost if hs is in foreground.
+Now logs unhandled exceptions when the tracker crashes.

*Fixed mulligan and deck count when using "No deck"-mode (either I messed it up again after this update or it's not fixed here yet. no-deck will be fixed with the next update though)
*Tracker window now remembers it's location

body:
Some don't seem to be aware of this: With new updates you can just copy over/not delete your old PlayerDecks.xml (and config for that matter) so you don't have to create the decks all over again every time. 

*HS should now be able to run at 120fps if overlay is hidden
*Windfury now get exported correctly
*Imported cards no longer have wrong manacost
*Exporter tries to click the spot for golden cards if two copies are supposed to be added. (Fixes the issue of only 1 card being added if you have 1 normal and 1 gold version of a card)

name: Release v0.2.9
body:
You can now just use your old config. Settings will not longer be overwritten and a config gets generates if there is none/you delete it.

**New Feature:**
You can now "export" your decks to Hearthstone. Not quite sure what to call it. (Button for it is in the top-right in My Decks)

Select a deck in the tracker, click "Export to HS" (it'll tell you to create a new deck in hs and leave the creation screen open) and the tracker will create the selected deck in Hearthstone.
Can be combined very nicely with importing decks from hearthpwn and hearthstats!

This is done purely via mouseclick/keystroke simulations (just like any macro tool), so don't worry, **no memory-editing-shenanigans happening**.

Does currently not work with golden cards (unless you don't have any non-golden, then yes) because without image recognition there is just no way to do it correctly.

If you/the tracker mess up and is not actually adding in the cards, don't panic and just let it finish.

I tested with all resolitions and it seems to work with all of them. 
**If it does however not hit the cards/searchbox for you or is too fast:** open the config and mess with the values at the bottom. Delays are in milliseconds, the x/y values are percentages. <SearchBoxX>0.5</SearchBoxX> means it clicks at 50% of your screen-width.

I could not really test "real" fullscreen, as my hearthstone does not go into "real" fullscreen for some reason.
It restores the window before starting the exporting though, so it should work I think (worst case, if it doesn't, should be a message telling you it can't find the hearthstone window).
